meanings.definition: A sudden violent entrance; a raid.
meanings.sent1: The irruption of the burglars into the house startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers made an irruption into the enemy camp under the cover of darkness.
meanings.sent3: The irruption of the mischievous raccoon into the picnic area caused quite a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The irruption of laughter from the comedy show filled the theater with joy.
meanings.sent5: The irruption of the volcano was a terrifying sight, spewing ash and lava into the sky.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase in numbers of a population, especially animals.
meanings.sent1: The irruption of rabbits in the field was a sign of a successful breeding season.
meanings.sent2: The irruption of birds in the garden brought a burst of color and song.
meanings.sent3: The irruption of squirrels in the park led to a shortage of acorns for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The irruption of tourists in the town during the festival boosted the local economy.
meanings.sent5: The irruption of fish in the river attracted a flurry of fishermen eager to catch them.
